inference:
The perimeter of square $ABCD$ is 48 inches, so each side of the square is 12 inches. Therefore, the side of the equilateral triangle $BFC$ is also 12 inches.
The perimeter of $ABFCDE$ is the perimeter of $ABCD$ minus the perimeter of $BFC$ plus the perimeter of $ABF$:
$$48-12+12+12+12=\boxed{56}$$
Final Answer: \boxed{$56$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Originally, every side length of the square had a length of 12.  Since the triangle is equilateral, each of its side lengths is also 12.  There are now a total of 6 sides, making for a perimeter of $\boxed{72}$.
